sections.description: Strathmroe is design inspired by a pad of paper in the hand. Subtle Textures and Layer shadows keep the readablity very high.

The ACC is focused on stable, conservative, clean fonts. Roboto Slab is the standard serif fonts across all products at the ACC. Muli is the current successor to Open Sans, and Maven is a slightly modern font to give a small level of interests which replaces Raleway, or Lato in other products.
A beuatiful slab font that shows a complexity and texture to the fonts used in the design.

sections.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes.

modifiers.name: .texture_light
modifiers.description: Light textures is reserved for the base of a page where it can gve a soft area for text or cards to live on top of.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_medium
modifiers.description: medium texture are used for area that are hidden away.  Collapsable navs, areas, or sidebars ususaly use the medium texture.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dust
modifiers.description: Dust is the most transparent texture allowing for the color of the background to show through the most.  This is used for the painted tops of cards, or score bars.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dark
modifiers.description: This texture predominatly used on the footer. Its rich black will alway requrie reversed text and buttons to be readable.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_cross
modifiers.description: A mostly transparent cross texture used for alternating rows of content when a little extra texture is needed.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_disabled
modifiers.description: This texture is used to paint disabled buttons and ui items giving it a greyed and X'ed out appearand.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

sections.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

sections.description: American College of Cardiology Logo

Strathmroe is strongly based on semantic HTML so much of the design will come together with basic structured html and minimal classes. The product uses zurb foundation so please read and understand its documentation to see how many of the basic items should be constructed before you manipulate with utiltiy classes or create new css.

sections.description: Utility Classes(UCs) are classes that control single styles allowing for quick manipulations of the appearance of the DOM. When combined with other UCs and toggled with javascripts you can create complex and new UI without the need of writing styles into the system. Examples of some UC built UIs can be found here as reciepes. Learn more about UCs in the Introduction section
sections.css: /* No styleguide reference. */

sections.description:
Anatomy of a Utility Class Name

The breakdown of the names for UCs follow a structured patter for easy muscle memory learning.
sections.markup:
All of the Class Names follow this ordered pattern of construction.

  1. State - Hover (Optional)
  2. Class Name
  3. Class Name Modifier (Optional)
  4. Value
  5. Value Modifier (Optional)
  6. Breakpoint (Optional)
  7. *Dividers can be : _ or - depending on usage
Example 1
Make the background color primary modified by the shading of negative 2 when the cursor has hovered over it.
I have the class h:bg_primary-n2
Long Name
hover
:
background-color
_
primary
-
n2
Utiltiy Class
h
:
bg
_
primary
-
n2
  1. 'h' => Interaction State
  2. `:`=> Interaction State Divider when use state interaction
  3. 'bg' => Class Name
  4. `_` => Value Divider think of this as an equal mark
  5. `primary` => Value
  6. `-` => Modifier Divider think of this as shift from the value
  7. `n2` => Modifier Values most follow a [n5 , n4, n3, n2, n1, {0 is default} , 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, color names, or secondary values]
  8. `:`=> Breakpoint Divider when rule should apply
  9. `lg`=> Breakpoint Value
Long Name Example 2
Add 1 rem of padding to the top when screen is medium and up
padding
-
top
_
1 rem = value 4
:
medium breakpoint
Utiltiy Class Example
p
-
t
_
4
:
md

sections.description: Borders a complex utility that demands a combo UCs to acheive their effect. The three UCs that must be used in combo are 'br_X' where x is the value need for style color and width. So to make an object with single black pixel border that is solid you would have to add '.br_solid.br_1.br_black'
Depends on base border module in _borders.css

sections.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes. It is easy to apply textures using the texture utlities.

modifiers.name: .texture_light
modifiers.description: Light textures is reserved for the base of a page where it can gve a soft area for text or cards to live on top of.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_medium
modifiers.description: medium texture are used for area that are hidden away.  Collapsable navs, areas, or sidebars ususaly use the medium texture.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_dust
modifiers.description: Dust is the most transparent texture allowing for the color of the background to show through the most.  This is used for the painted tops of cards, or score bars.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_dark
modifiers.description: This texture predominatly used on the footer. Its rich black will alway requrie reversed text and buttons to be readable.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_cross
modifiers.description: A mostly transparent cross texture used for alternating rows of content when a little extra texture is needed.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_disabled
modifiers.description: This texture is used to paint disabled buttons and ui items giving it a greyed and X'ed out appearand.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.markup:
5.1Genetic Predisposition
{$modifiers}
II
b
SAVE SHARE PRINT

Hypertension is a complex polygenic disorder in which many genes or gene combinations influenceBP[1], [2]. Although several monogenic forms of hypertension have been identified, such asglucocorticoid-remediable aldosteronism, Liddle’s syndrome, Gordon’s syndrome, and others in whichsingle-gene mutations fully explain the pathophysiology of hypertension, these disorders are rare(S5.1-3). The current tabulation of known genetic variantscontributing to BP and hypertension includes more than 25 rare mutations and 120 single-nucleotidepolymorphisms[1], [2]. However, even with the discovery of multiple single-nucleotide polymorphismsinfluencing control of BP since completion of the Human Genome Project in 2003, the associated variants haveonly small effects. Indeed, at present, the collective effect of all BP loci identified through genome-wideassociation studies accounts for only about 3.5% of BP variability(S5.1-4). The presence of a high number of small-effect alleles associated withhigher BP results in a more rapid increase in BP with age(S5.1-5). Future studies will need to better elucidate genetic expression, epigeneticeffects, transcriptomics, and proteomics that link genotypes with underlying pathophysiological mechanisms.

International Organization for Standardization. (2016). Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with Heart
Focused Update: March 15, 2018
FULL DOC PDF HUB
cite document:  International Organization for Standardization. (2016). Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with Heart

The presence of a high number of small-effect alleles associated withhigher BP results in a more rapid increase in BP with age(S5.1-5). Future studies will need to better elucidate genetic expression, epigeneticeffects, transcriptomics, and proteomics that link genotypes with underlying pathophysiological mechanisms.

section.description: Strathmroe is design inspired by a pad of paper in the hand. Subtle Textures and Layer shadows keep the readablity very high.

The ACC is focused on stable, conservative, clean fonts. Roboto Slab is the standard serif fonts across all products at the ACC. Muli is the current successor to Open Sans, and Maven is a slightly modern font to give a small level of interests which replaces Raleway, or Lato in other products.
A beuatiful slab font that shows a complexity and texture to the fonts used in the design.

section.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes.

modifiers.name: .texture_light
modifiers.description: Light textures is reserved for the base of a page where it can gve a soft area for text or cards to live on top of.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_medium
modifiers.description: medium texture are used for area that are hidden away.  Collapsable navs, areas, or sidebars ususaly use the medium texture.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dust
modifiers.description: Dust is the most transparent texture allowing for the color of the background to show through the most.  This is used for the painted tops of cards, or score bars.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_dark
modifiers.description: This texture predominatly used on the footer. Its rich black will alway requrie reversed text and buttons to be readable.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_cross
modifiers.description: A mostly transparent cross texture used for alternating rows of content when a little extra texture is needed.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers} with a light primary color background

modifiers.name: .texture_disabled

section.description: Utility Classes(UCs) are classes that control single styles allowing for quick manipulations of the appearance of the DOM. When combined with other UCs and toggled with javascripts you can create complex and new UI without the need of writing styles into the system. Examples of some UC built UIs can be found here as reciepes. Learn more about UCs in the Introduction section
section.css: /* No styleguide reference. */

section.description:
Anatomy of a Utility Class Name

The breakdown of the names for UCs follow a structured patter for easy muscle memory learning.
section.markup:
All of the Class Names follow this ordered pattern of construction.

  1. State - Hover (Optional)
  2. Class Name
  3. Class Name Modifier (Optional)
  4. Value
  5. Value Modifier (Optional)
  6. Breakpoint (Optional)
  7. *Dividers can be : _ or - depending on usage
Example 1
Make the background color primary modified by the shading of negative 2 when the cursor has hovered over it.
I have the class h:bg_primary-n2
Long Name
hover
:
background-color
_
primary
-
n2
Utiltiy Class
h
:
bg
_
primary
-
n2
  1. 'h' => Interaction State
  2. `:`=> Interaction State Divider when use state interaction
  3. 'bg' => Class Name
  4. `_` => Value Divider think of this as an equal mark
  5. `primary` => Value
  6. `-` => Modifier Divider think of this as shift from the value
  7. `n2` => Modifier Values most follow a [n5 , n4, n3, n2, n1, {0 is default} , 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, color names, or secondary values]
  8. `:`=> Breakpoint Divider when rule should apply
  9. `lg`=> Breakpoint Value
Long Name Example 2
Add 1 rem of padding to the top when screen is medium and up
padding
-
top
_
1 rem = value 4
:
medium breakpoint
Utiltiy Class Example
p
-
t
_
4
:
md

section.description: Padding and Margins are the most common usage for Utility Classes. Spacing UC's are responsive and can be postfixed with -medium and with -large to have finer control on the spacing of objects.
section.css: /* No styleguide reference. */

section.description:
Is Responsive: breakpoint modifiers

section.description: Borders a complex utility that demands a combo UCs to acheive their effect. The three UCs that must be used in combo are 'br_X' where x is the value need for style color and width. So to make an object with single black pixel border that is solid you would have to add '.br_solid.br_1.br_black'
Depends on base border module in _borders.css

section.description: All textures in the Strathmore design are a subtle variation of transparent. Allowing for colors to bleed through from behind. Different textures have intentions or are reserved for certain usagaes. It is easy to apply textures using the texture utlities.

modifiers.name: .texture_light
modifiers.description: Light textures is reserved for the base of a page where it can gve a soft area for text or cards to live on top of.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_medium
modifiers.description: medium texture are used for area that are hidden away.  Collapsable navs, areas, or sidebars ususaly use the medium texture.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_dust
modifiers.description: Dust is the most transparent texture allowing for the color of the background to show through the most.  This is used for the painted tops of cards, or score bars.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_dark
modifiers.description: This texture predominatly used on the footer. Its rich black will alway requrie reversed text and buttons to be readable.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_cross
modifiers.description: A mostly transparent cross texture used for alternating rows of content when a little extra texture is needed.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: .texture_disabled
modifiers.description: This texture is used to paint disabled buttons and ui items giving it a greyed and X'ed out appearand.
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

SAVE SHARE PRINT

Hypertension is a complex polygenic disorder in which many genes or gene combinations influenceBP[1], [2]. Although several monogenic forms of hypertension have been identified, such asglucocorticoid-remediable aldosteronism, Liddle’s syndrome, Gordon’s syndrome, and others in whichsingle-gene mutations fully explain the pathophysiology of hypertension, these disorders are rare(S5.1-3). The current tabulation of known genetic variantscontributing to BP and hypertension includes more than 25 rare mutations and 120 single-nucleotidepolymorphisms[1], [2]. However, even with the discovery of multiple single-nucleotide polymorphismsinfluencing control of BP since completion of the Human Genome Project in 2003, the associated variants haveonly small effects. Indeed, at present, the collective effect of all BP loci identified through genome-wideassociation studies accounts for only about 3.5% of BP variability(S5.1-4). The presence of a high number of small-effect alleles associated withhigher BP results in a more rapid increase in BP with age(S5.1-5). Future studies will need to better elucidate genetic expression, epigeneticeffects, transcriptomics, and proteomics that link genotypes with underlying pathophysiological mechanisms.
